result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L. Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Continue mental health care.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; credit for one day served if revoked.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  PLEAS set for 2/27/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Severino states the deft completed the Circle of Change program.  FPT continued to 2/6/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Severino states the deft is in the Circle of Change program.  FPT continued to 1/13/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Severino and by agreement of ADA Phan the FPT of 9/10/14 at 8:30am is rescheduled to 10/21/14 at 8:30am to give deft time to complete the Circle of Change program.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Severino state the deft is in the Circle of Change Program.  DA PTC 8/15/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/10/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Severino.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Severino acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 3/21/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 3/24/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
